BWPanda said:

When you're theming a site and you need to change when a drop-down menu changes to a menu toggle button (i.e. a hamburger menu), how do you do that?

it's fairly easy. Just use @media with the breakpoint you want and then hide the dropdown menu (display:none) and unhide the menu-toggle. ex:
@media screen and (max-width: 48em) {
#main-menu { display:none; }
#menu-toggle-button {display:block;}
}
The exact syntax and breakpoints depend on your particular theme and use case. I find I prefer to go to the menu toggle at the biggest point it makes sense.

@Elisabeth Garbeil Yeah I started with that, but then realised I needed to add more and more CSS into those media queries to get everything working properly. There's quite a lot in the core CSS files I mentioned above that needs accounting for that make simply overriding the media queries nontrivial.

I've finally adapted the hints for my Basis sub-theme: I've copied menu-toggle.theme.css (from system module) and menu-dropdown.css (from Basis core theme) to my sub-theme and changed the breakpoints.

This works generally. One thing is strange, though. In the .info file, I've declared the CSS files in this order:

stylesheets[all][] = css/menu-dropdown.css
stylesheets[all][] = css/menu-toggle.theme.css
stylesheets[all][] = css/skin.css

In the document HEAD, skin.css is imported first, before the other two files. I guess because I use the name skin.css, which is also a file in Basis. Is it possible to change the order, so that skin.css is imported last?
